properties.name: quickfixj.client.config
properties.description: The location of the configuration file to use to initialize QuickFIX/J client.

properties.name: quickfixj.client.auto-startup
properties.description: Whether the client should get started automatically.

properties.name: quickfixj.client.phase
properties.description: The spring initialisation phase in which the client will start.

properties.name: quickfixj.client.jmx-enabled
properties.description: Whether to register the Jmx MBeans for the client.

properties.name: quickfixj.client.concurrent.enabled
properties.description: Whether to use SocketInitiator or ThreadedSocketInitiator. Default is false (SocketInitiator)

properties.name: quickfixj.client.message-store-factory
properties.description: The message store factory to use. Possible values: cachedfile, file, jdbc, memory, noop, sleepycat

properties.name: quickfixj.client.log-factory
properties.description: The log factory to use. Possible values: compositelog, file, jdbc, slf4j, screen

properties.name: quickfixj.server.config
properties.description: The location of the configuration file to use to initialize QuickFIX/J server.

properties.name: quickfixj.server.auto-startup
properties.description: Whether the server should get started automatically.

properties.name: quickfixj.server.phase
properties.description: The spring initialisation phase in which the server will start.

properties.name: quickfixj.server.jmx-enabled
properties.description: Whether to register the Jmx MBeans for the server.

properties.name: quickfixj.server.concurrent.enabled
properties.description: Whether to use SocketAcceptor or ThreadedSocketAcceptor. Default is false (SocketAcceptor)

properties.name: quickfixj.server.message-store-factory
properties.description: The message store factory to use. Possible values: cachedfile, file, jdbc, memory, noop, sleepycat

properties.name: quickfixj.server.log-factory
properties.description: The log factory to use. Possible values: compositelog, file, jdbc, slf4j, screen
